body:
Problem:

Currently terminal highlight attribute buffers are statically allocated be the size of `TERM_ATTRS_MAX`. This unique case isn't respected in some places in the ui_compositor. Due to this, when a terminal window has lines longer them `TERM_ATTRS_MAX`, the compositor will go past the end of the buffer causing a crash due to out of bounds access.

Solution:

Pass this `max_attrs` value down to the compositor's line drawing code so that we can prevent going out of bounds. This will be set to `TERM_ATTRS_MAX` for terminals, and 0 if there is no limit.

Fixes #30374

comment_data.body: Sorry about that! I just dropped it, that was from lsp auto-include.

```suggestion
  SLF_TERMATTRS  = 8,  // Indicates the line is in a terminal buffer, so we must not exceed
                       // index `TERM_ATTRS_MAX` in the highlight attributes.
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -30,9 +30,12 @@ EXTERN char *linebuf_scratch INIT( = NULL);
 
 /// flags for grid_put_linebuf()
 enum {
-  SLF_RIGHTLEFT = 1,
-  SLF_WRAP      = 2,
-  SLF_INC_VCOL  = 4,
+  SLF_RIGHTLEFT   = 1,
+  SLF_WRAP        = 2,
+  SLF_INC_VCOL    = 4,
+  SLF_TERM_ATTRS  = 8,  // On if this line is associated with a terminal buffer. If so then we need
+                        // to ensure we don't go past index `TERM_ATTRS_MAX` in the highlight
+                        // attributes.

comment_data.body:
Is this the only place where `max_attrs` is used? This code is only for debugging (`#ifndef NDEBUG`).

And even if it wasn't, adding a parameter in many places, and setting a special `SLF_TERM_ATTRS` flag per-line, does not seem like the right fix.

So you are right, one option is to drop the assert, that would make it so I don't have to pass the max_attrs down. Another option is to find a better way to identify if this line belongs to a window on a terminal buffer. 

The final option which in my mind is ideal is to handle terminal highlight attrs the same way we handle highlight attrs in other buffers so that we don't have this special case. I believe (I would have to look into this deeper) that for other buffers, there will always be the same number of columns as highlight attrs for a line.

I couldn't figure out why the terminal is the one buffer type where we can have less highlight attrs the columns. I would honestly prefer to just limit the amount of columns and highlight attrs for terminals to 1024 rather than just highlight attrs. Ideally the ui compositor doesn't have to worry about this special case at all.

Do you have any thoughts on what solution of those you would prefer? Because I agree that I really don't like adding args an flags to all these functions just because of terminals being this one special case.

> I believe (I would have to look into this deeper) that for other buffers, there will always be the same number of columns as highlight attrs for a line.
